meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unchangeable or immutable.
meanings.sent1: The inalterableness of the ancient stone walls amazed the archaeologists.
meanings.sent2: The inalterableness of the laws of nature is a fundamental principle in science.
meanings.sent3: The inalterableness of the recipe made it impossible for the chef to add any new ingredients.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was as inalterable as the position of the North Star in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The inalterableness of the mountain range gave it a timeless beauty.

meanings.definition: The inability to be altered or modified.
meanings.sent1: The inalterableness of the contract meant that no changes could be made.
meanings.sent2: The inalterableness of the diamond's structure made it incredibly durable.
meanings.sent3: The inalterableness of the stubborn old man's opinions often led to arguments.
meanings.sent4: The inalterableness of her decision surprised everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The inalterableness of the rule was a source of frustration for many.
